t: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David the servant of the Lord.
The*p transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.
For*p he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful.
The*p words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, and to do good.
He*p deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good; he abhorreth not evil.
Thy*p mercy, O Lord,*s is in the heavens; and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.
Thy*p righteousness is like the great mountains; thy judgments are a great deep: O Lord,*s thou preservest man and beast.
How*p excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.
They*p shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.
For*p with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.
O*p continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.
Let*p not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.
There*p are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.
